title: California Firm Recalls Assorted Meat Products Due To Mislabeling And An Undeclared Allergen
summary: WASHINGTON, April 17, 2010 - Westlake Food Corporation, a Santa Ana, Calif., establishment, is recalling approximately 140,000 pounds of fully cooked assorted meat products because they contain an undeclared allergen, wheat starch, the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) announced today...

establishment.name: West Lake Food Corporation
establishment.address:
2430 W. Cape Cod Way 
  Santa Ana, CA 92703

impacted_products: 14-ounce packages of "GIO LUA TAY HO PORK MEAT LOAF WRAPPED IN BANANA LEAVES FULLY COOKED."
13-ounce packages of "BO VIEN TAY HO BEEF MEAT BALL FULLY COOKED."
